results.title: Nostalgia = Nostalghia
results.creator_credit: Andrei Tarkovsky, Francesco Casati, Opera Film Produzione, Radiotelevisione Italiana and Sovin Film
results.brief_description: This is Tarkovsky’s haunting first film made outside of Russia. The story explores the melancholy of the expatriate through the eyes of the film’s protagonist, Gorchakov, a Russian poet researching in Italy. Arriving at a Tuscan village spa with Eugenia, his beautiful Italian interpreter, Gorchakov is visited by memories of Russia and of his wife and children, and encounters the local mystic, who sets him a challenging task. The film is filled with mysterious and extraordinary images, culminating in the final scene where all the film’s images coalesce into a miraculous whole. As in all Tarkovsky films, nature and the elements of fire and water, music, painting and poetry, and the contrast of black and white and colour photography, all play a major role. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Fellini Satyricon
results.creator_credit: Federico Fellini, Alberto Grimaldi and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: More than any other director, Fredrico Fellini has created a coherent universe compounded of his personal vision and anxiety, where each work is held together by filaments of memory and imagery. All his films are picaresque and fragmentary, representing a subliminal search by the protagonist(s) for a life more fulfilling than the one lived now. The Rome of his Satyricon is borne out of his imagination. In it the costumes, lighting, architecture, gestures, eating habits, all forms of behaviour, conspire to startle and disorient the viewer. For years Fellini had contemplated a film version of Petronius’ book, a fragmentary account of a group of Roman students on a seemingly meandering journey, its unfinished quality appealing to his open-ended, fractured style of filmmaking. Cast includes Martin Potter, Max Born, Hiram Keller, Capucine, Lucia Bose, Gorden Mitchell and Alain Cuny. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Mirror
results.creator_credit: Andrei Tarkovsky, Erik Waisberg and Mosfilm
results.brief_description: Mirror is hailed as Tarkovsky’s greatest work. The film is autobiographical - a mirror is held up to both Tarkovsky’s childhood and to the destiny of the Russian people. It is many-layered and intertwines real life and family relationships with memories of childhood, dreams and nightmares. Tarkovsky also adds topical newsreel sequences. His father, the poet Arseny Tarkovsky, reads his own peoms on the soundtrack and his mother appears as herself. The actress Margarita Terekhova plays the dual roles of the mother as a young woman and the wife of the adult man. From the opening sequences of a boy being cured of a stammer by hypnotism, to a scene in a printing works which encapsulates the Stalinist era, “Mirror” has an extraordinary resonance and repays countless viewings.

results.title: The Flower of my secret = La Flor de mi secreto
results.creator_credit: Pedro Almodovar and Globe Film Co
results.brief_description: Another fine contribution from renowned Spanish director Pedro Almodovar, who returns to the comedy of his earlier works in this humorous yet moving film about a woman in the throes of a creative and emotional crisis. Years of writing bestselling romantic fiction under the pseudonym Amanda Gris have started to take their toll on Leo (Marisa Paredes), who yearns to express herself through a blacker style of writing. Bound by her contract, and immersed in denial over the disintegration of her marriage to Paco (Imanol Arias), she spirals dangerously toward a total breakdown. Her only salvation appears in the form of Angel (Juan Echanove), who offers her a job as a critic for a national arts supplement. Leo’s first assignment - to write a critique of her alter ego, Amanda Gris - sets in motion a chain of events which force her to face reality, and sever ties with the fears of the past. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Carry on up the Khyber
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers, Peter Rogers Productions and Rank Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Carry on”.
It is 1895 and the British occupation of India is threatened by revolutionary uprisings. In order for the revolutionaries to attack the British troops they need to cross the notorious Khyber Pass. The history and politics of the British Raj, however, is simply a convenient background for the Carry On team to conduct their regular mix of hilarious slap-stick and tongue-in-cheek camp. Cast includes Sidney James, Kenneth Williams, Joan Sims and a large supporting cast of British comedians.

results.title: Carry on Dick
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Carry on”.
The 26th ‘Carry on’ film is one of mistaken identities and secret lives. Highwayman Dick Turpin - Big Dick (Sid James), is also the town rector, ably supported by Harry and Tom (Barbara Windsor and Peter Butterworth) - his parlour maid and the man who pumps the church’s organ. There is only one weak link in the chain - a noticeable birthmark on Turpin’s privates which will require the assistance of a bevy of busty women to bring to light. The charge will be led by Captain Fancy and Jock Strap. Cast also includes Kenneth Williams, Hattie Jacques, Bernard Bresslaw and Joan Sims.

results.title: Carry on abroad: or, what a package: or, it's all in: or, Swiss hols in the snow
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Carry on”.
The 23rd “Carry on” film finds a gang of prim and proper British tourists on a disastrous holiday. This is despite the reassuring name of the tour organisers and their location - Wundatours on a package tour of the Paradise island of Elsbels on the Costa Plonka. Their dreams of a luxury hotel quickly disintegrate when they discover the hotel is still being built, there’s faulty wiring, a leaky roof, all staff look suspiciously alike and there’s a disgruntled cook. Add to this the usual carry on shenanigans surrounding beds and showers and we are in for a holiday like no other. Cast includes Sidney James, Kenneth Williams, Charles Hawtrey, Joan Sims, Bernard Bresslaw, Barbara Windsor, Kenneth Connor and Hattie Jacques.

results.title: Carry on doctor
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Carry on”.
Britain’s favourite comedy team “carry on” as they only know how! “Carry on Doctor” looks at life in a country hospital when the patients revolt against the staff. Hattie Jacques is the fearsome Matron, Kenneth Williams the cold-hearted Doctor Tinkle, while Sid James as the malingerer Mr. Roper, takes a vacation in hospital. A madcap romp of bandages and stethescopes, Frankie Howard as Mr. Bigger hams it up while Charles Hawtrey gives an unforgettable performance as an expectant father suffering all the symptoms of pregnancy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers and Rank Organisation Film Productions

results.title: Analyze this = Analyse this
results.creator_credit: Harold Ramis, Jane Rosenthal, Paula Weinstein, Village Roadshow Pictures and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Mob boss Paul Vitti (Robert DeNiro) is having trouble sleeping on the eve of a planned meeting between rival Mafia gangs. His anxiety soon turns into a full blown panic attack prompting the tough guy to contact psychiatrist Ben Sobel (Billy Crystal). The neurotic Sobel initially refuses to take Vitti on as a patient but soon finds that the desperate criminal doesn’t take rejection well. Director Harold Ramis uses this comedic premise effectively, parodying the mobs ‘tough guy’ ethos, while lampooning an assortment of familiar gangster films. The casting of DeNiro is a joke in itself as the actor sends up his previous film incarnations as the quintessential Mafia ‘wiseguy’. Cast also includes Lisa Kudrow, Chazz Palminteri and Joe Viterelli.

His anxiety soon turns into a full blown panic attack prompting the tough guy to contact psychiatrist Ben Sobel (Billy Crystal). The neurotic Sobel initially refuses to take Vitti on as a patient but soon finds that the desperate criminal doesn’t take rejection well. Director Harold Ramis uses this comedic premise effectively, parodying the mobs ‘tough guy’ ethos, while lampooning an assortment of familiar gangster films. The casting of DeNiro is a joke in itself as the actor sends up his previous film incarnations as the quintessential Mafia ‘wiseguy’. Cast also includes Lisa Kudrow, Chazz Palminteri and Joe Viterelli.

results.title: Accused
results.creator_credit: Thornton Freeland, Douglas Fairbanks, Marcel Hellman and Criterion Film Productions
results.brief_description: A British melodrama set around a Paris dance troupe and the main performers, Tony (Douglas Fairbanks Jr) and Gaby (Dolores Del Rio) Seymour. When dancer Yvette Delange (Florence Desmond) begins to direct her attentions to the somewhat unwilling Tony, a quarrel ensues between Yvette and Gaby. The sudden death by stabbing of Yvette causes suspicion to fall on Gaby and it is only when the trial takes place, the true identity of the murderer is unmasked. Cast also includes Basil Sydney, Googie Withers, Cecil Humphreys.
